derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, via Latin from Greek mantikhōras, corrupt reading in Aristotle for martikhoras, from an Old Persian word meaning 'maneater'

means.word_mean: 1. a mythical monster having the head of man (with horns) and the body of a lion and the tail of a scorpion
